Class Book

  • java.lang.Object
    • Book

  • public class Book
extends java.lang.Object

    COMP 249 section PP Assignment # 1

    Due Date: January 31, 2018

    This Book Class contains several methods which allow us to manipulate book objects stored in an array of objects. The class contains constructor, accessor, mutator, equals, and toString methods, as well as several methods that validate user input and static methods that perform searches through the array of objects.

    Author:
    Giselle Martel ID# 26352936

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Book()
      default constructor of the Book class which is called when Book object is created without parameters and sets attributes to default values.
      Book(Book b)
      copy constructor for Book class that takes a Book object b and makes a copy (part 1)
      Book(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String author, long isbn, double price)
      parameterized constructor for Book class that takes 4 parameters and sets each to their respective attribute for the book object.

        copy constructor for Book class that takes a Book object b and makes a copy (part 1)
        Parameters:
        b - is a book object which will be used to make a copy

      • Book

        public Book(java.lang.String title,
            java.lang.String author,
            long isbn,
            double price)
        parameterized constructor for Book class that takes 4 parameters and sets each to their respective attribute for the book object. Increments static attribute instanceCounter each time a book object is created to track total number of book objects
        Parameters:
        title - is an attribute of book object
        author - is an attribute of book object
        isbn - is an attribute of book object
        price - is an attribute of book object

      • findNumberOfCreatedBooks

        public static int findNumberOfCreatedBooks()
        findNumberOfCreatedBooks is a static method
        Returns:
        the value of created objects using the static attribute instanceCounter.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Book b)
        create equals method which takes Book object b as a parameter to determine if two book objects have the same price and same isbn
        Parameters:
        b - is a book object which will be compared to another book object
        Returns:
        method will return true if both book objects have same price and isbn

      • verifyPassword

        public boolean verifyPassword()
        VerifyPassword method takes user String input and verifies if it is a match to a predefined password using a while loop. If the user makes 3 unsuccessful password attempts, the method will return a boolean value which will prevent the user from continuing
        Returns:
        boolean passwordChecker as a true value when the user makes 3 unsuccessful password attempts.

      • validateInput

        public int validateInput(int max)
        this method ensures a user enters a valid integer, positive integer when prompted by using a while loop. The integer cannot exceed the value of the parameter max. When the user enters a double or String value, they will be re-prompted to enter until an integer value is entered.
        Parameters:
        max - is a maximum value that cannot be exceeded by user input.
        Returns:
        an int value that the user enters

      • validateInput

        public int validateInput()
        this overloaded method ensures a user enters a valid integer, positive integer when prompted by using a while loop. It does not take a paremter. When the user enters a double or String value, they will be reprompted to enter until an integer value is entered.
        Returns:
        an int value that the user enters

      • validateNumBooks

        public int validateNumBooks(int max)
        this method ensures a user enters a valid number of books by verifying that they do not enter more books than the max allowed (taken as parameter when method is called).
        Parameters:
        max - is a value that cannot be exceeded by user input.
        Returns:
        a valid int value that the user enters

      • quitProgram

        public boolean quitProgram()
        This method prompts the user if they would like to quit the program, and will do so by first validating the input and then quitting the program immediately or returning a true boolean value
        Returns:
        true when the user does not wish to quit the program. This boolean value will be used in the main method to re-initialize the main menu.

      • validatePrice

        public double validatePrice()
        this method ensures a user enters a valid positive floating point number when prompted for a price.
        Returns:
        a double price that the user enters.

      • findBooksBy

        public static void findBooksBy(java.lang.String author,
                               Book[] inventory,
                               int bookCounter)
        static method which compares if a String entered by user matches the author attribute stored in each index of inventory array. When a match is found, the book object will be displayed to user. (part 2)
        Parameters:
        author - is the String value of the author entered by the user, and will be used to find any matches within the array of objects.
        inventory - is the array of book objects which we will search through in this method
        bookCounter - is the total number of created book objects which we will need to define the boundaries of the for-loop

      • findCheaperThan

        public static void findCheaperThan(double price,
                                   Book[] inventory,
                                   int bookCounter)
        Static method which loops through each index of inventory array to see which book objects have a price lower than indicated by parameter (part 2)
        Parameters:
        price - is the value of user input and will be used to compare
        inventory - is the array of book objects which we will search through in this method
        bookCounter - is the total number of created book objects which we will need to define the boundaries of the for-loop.
